greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square table T(n, d) read by antidiagonals: number of ways to place 2 nonattacking kings on an n^d (n X n X ...) raumschach board (hypercubical chessboard).
example: There are T(3, 4) = 2080 ways to place 2 nonattacking kings on a 3^4 (3 X 3 X 3 X 3) hypercubical chessboard.
The antidiagonals are read from southwest to northeast.
results.author: _Andrew Woods_, Aug 30 2011
